## R

``` {.r}
fizz_buzz <- function(fbnums = 1:50) {
  output <- dplyr::case_when(
    fbnums %% 15 == 0 ~ "FizzBuzz",
    fbnums %% 3 == 0 ~ "Fizz",
    fbnums %% 5 == 0 ~ "Buzz",
    TRUE ~ as.character(fbnums)
  )
  print(output)
}
```

## Python

``` {.python}
def fizz_buzz(num):
  if num % 15 == 0:
    print("FizzBuzz")
  elif num % 5 == 0:
    print("Buzz")
  elif num % 3 == 0:
    print("Fizz")
  else:
    print(num)
```

In 2020 a tidal trubine with 12 optical fibre linked hydrophones was deployed in northern Scotland. Each hydrophone sampled at 500kHz streaming 6 million samples per second to shore. PAMGuard ran for two years in real time, detecting likley porpoise and dolphins and sampling various soundscape metrics.
